name: Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago
mission: Teaching and reading of the holy Quran, daily and Friday congregations, Islamic Education for Children and perform marriages and funeral services
zakatClaimEvidence: The Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs (ISNS) explicitly states, "Donate your ZAKAT to ISNS" and provides methods for donation including mailing a check, dropping it off in a Zakah drop box, and an online Zakat Request form. They also have a 'Zakah Committee'. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEr-QOAlaTAz8LEo8cQ8DlG45doyUBd26Mt0abRpz31opnn0gBjVUk2JEYNDGvNOiU9__wZra--15Td9lG74AIG0HO-N1OhjvJA_X2YxnnIH2oJgBv8T-hixYZaK9hNefmP_DpXu5x4pgdXGwKNZw==)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

amalEvaluation.charity_name: Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: masakin (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago shows moderate alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs (ISNS) explicitly states, "Donate your ZAKAT to ISNS" and provides methods for donation including mailing a check, dropping it off in a Zakah drop box, and an online Zakat Request form. They also have a 'Zakah Committee'. (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEr-QOAlaTAz8LEo8cQ8DlG45doyUBd26Mt0abRpz31opnn0gBjVUk2JEYNDGvNOiU9__wZra--15Td9lG74AIG0HO-N1OhjvJA_X2YxnnIH2oJgBv8T-hixYZaK9hNefmP_DpXu5x4pgdXGwKNZw==)

all_citations.claim: The organization provides religious services, Islamic education for children, and funeral services.
The charity reported total revenue of $4,092,615, a program expense ratio of 92.5%, and 117.3 months of working capital.
The organization provides various donation options for community members to support its mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and strong alignment with religious donor needs, though its total score is tempered by low data confidence and limited evidence of measurable impact outcomes.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party impact data and external evaluations of program outcomes
Low data confidence due to limited publicly available documentation beyond basic financial filings

dimension_explanations.alignment: With a score of 27/50, the charity shows a moderate alignment for donors seeking to support religious and cultural causes, offering Zakat-eligible giving options for essential community services like marriages and funerals [1][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates strong financial health with a program expense ratio of 92.5% and 117.3 months of working capital, though its impact score of 22/50 reflects a focus on capacity building rather than direct evidence of long-term social outcomes [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago serves as a vital community hub providing comprehensive religious services and early childhood Islamic education.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 92.5%, ensuring the vast majority of funds directly support community services
Exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.01 to raise every $1
Significant financial stability with 117.3 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Society of Northwest Suburbs of Chicago (ISNS) is a religious non-profit dedicated to the teaching of the holy Quran, daily congregations, and funeral services [1]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $4,092,615 to support its spiritual and educational programming [2].
